abstract.p: Chicago entertainer and acrobat David Fisher, who calls himself the Rope Warrior and is accompanied by seven expert rope jumpers and dog, will perform at Newark Museum as part of free Summer Youth Theater (S)

block.p: David Fisher is so crazy about jumping rope that he has devised a way to make a living doing it.

The Chicago entertainer and acrobat calls himself the ''Rope Warrior'' and travels the world demonstrating his skill to audiences of both children and adults, including a performance for President Clinton and Vice President Al Gore. Mr. Fisher is accompanied by seven expert rope jumpers and a dog, Olive Oyl, who has made the Guinness Book of World Records for jumping rope.
David Fisher is so crazy about jumping rope that he has devised a way to make a living doing it.

The Chicago entertainer and acrobat calls himself the ''Rope Warrior'' and travels the world demonstrating his skill to audiences of both children and adults, including a performance for President Clinton and Vice President Al Gore. Mr. Fisher is accompanied by seven expert rope jumpers and a dog, Olive Oyl, who has made the Guinness Book of World Records for jumping rope.
The 90-minute extravaganza features a unicycle-riding and stilt-walking jumper. The fast-paced show of circus theatrics and glow-in-the-dark ropes is set to flashy music.
Mr. Fisher and his jumping entourage perform Friday at 1 p.m. at the Newark Museum as part of the free Summer Youth Theater.
On Aug. 11, the New Jersey Chamber Music Society will introduce children to the trumpet, trombone, tuba and French horn in a program known as the Versatile Brass Family.
